file_content.text: Nice to see you alive and well. That was really rotten what Nem'ro did to you.
One day, he'll pay for crossing me.
I'll get even.
Maybe that's exactly what these credits are for.
Aw, were you worried about me?
You care?
Well, those pits are brutal.
Maybe a little--but don't read too much into it....
Whatever do you mean?
When?
If you don't want to talk about it, I understand.
I've got a very large payment here for you, but it doesn't say what for. Apparently that's between you and Nem'ro.
A large stack of credits does wonders for my affection level.
He knows me so well.
Did you know I'm going to the Great Hunt?
I'm pretty important.
That's the word on the street.
Another day, another blood stain.
No big deal.
Here you go. One large payment for mysterious reasons.
Don't spend it all in one place.
Hey, girl, we've been had! Nem'ro's already sponsored someone for the Great Hunt!
Hey, hunter, we've been had! Nem'ro's already sponsored someone for the Great Hunt!
That's old news, Mako.
I already know.
Yeah? Bet you don't know who it is, though.
How do you hear these things so fast?
That was quick.
You'd think people would secure their comm channels better. Don't they understand I'm a genius?
Who did that bloated pile of guts Nem'ro pick over me?
Who is it?
Once again I've got the info everyone wants. Come to the hotel, and we'll talk.
Don't toy with me. Who got that sponsorship token?
Tell me now.
Have to tell you in person. Someone could overhear.
How'd you already find out who got my sponsorship?
You have the name?
I'm not saying anything over a non-secure channel.
Did I ever mention that I think you do great work, Mako?
You're amazing.
Really? Thank you.
Now hurry back here! Plenty of other people are trying to find this guy. Mako out.
Took you long enough! Finding Nem'ro's sponsorship token not a priority?
This is serious, Mako.
Enough playing around.
You're right. Won't happen again, boss.
Things tend to come up in our line of work.
I was delayed.
I'm just playing. Even when the situation's serious, doesn't mean you have to be.
Get to the point, little girl.
Stop wasting my time.
Little girl? Seriously? If that's all I am to you, prepare to be shocked.
I know who got Nem'ro's sponsorship token and how to find him. I'll tell you everything, but I've got a price.
Suddenly you expect me to pay for your info?
Credits?
Not like you think.
I saw this coming a long way off.
I figured as much.
Yeah, I'll bet you did.
Is that your idea of a joke?
Not funny.
Do you see me smiling?
Braden taught me how to fight, and you know I'm great with information. Take me with you--on this hunt and whatever comes after.
I think we'll have a lot of fun.
Sure, kid.
I'm good with a blaster, and Braden was like a father to me. It's not fair that--wait, did you just say yes?
I'm not sure....
Well, you better get keen--and fast. Without me, you'll never find Nem'ro's new pet.
You'd just slow me down. I'm a solo act.
I work alone.
Then I guess it ends here--your quest for glory, vengeance for Braden, all of it.
You can't leave me on this lousy mudball where Braden died! You want the info, you take me!
All right, all right. Calm down and you can come along.
Keep your boots on.
You're right, I can't leave you here. Partners it is.
Okay, you win.
You can come, but you'd better pull your own weight.
Don't make me regret it.
Thank you. Braden was sweet, but he always treated me like a child. I'm not a child. So thank you.
I want to be there when we find Braden's killer. I want that more than anything. So let's go find Nem'ro's bounty hunter.
You prepared to go toe-to-toe with this guy?
Ready to fight?
Whatever it takes to get you into the Great Hunt.
I can't do anything until I know who I'm chasing.
Then give me a name, already.
Let's start some trouble.
Good. You're about to get plenty of it.
The hunter we're after is named Rarsk. He's a Trandoshan and serious bad news. Burned a whole village alive on Dantooine.
I intercepted a transmission between the Trandoshan and--get this--the bone-faced freak who was following me. Remember me warning you about him?
Think those two are working together?
I remember.
No clue. We better prepare for anything, though.
What exactly is a "Trandoshan"?
"Trandoshan"?
Lizard people. Cold-blooded in every sense of the word. They worship a goddess they believe wants them to treat everyone else like prey.
Just tell me where we're going.
Give me a location.
Rarsk is collecting on a bounty Fa'athra the Hutt, Nem'ro's rival, is holding for him. A Republic scientist or something.
All we have to do is break into Fa'athra's ridiculously well-guarded palace in the swamp, find the scientist ourselves and set a trap for Rarsk.
And when Rarsk shows, we take his sponsorship token. Good plan.
Clever girl.
You haven't seen anything yet.
Sounds like suicide to me.
Won't be easy.
I know! And it gets better.
If your plan blows up in my face, you'll be sorry.
This had better work--or else.
There's another reason to risk our necks.
Turns out Fa'athra keeps interesting people on his payroll--and by "interesting," I mean they have prices on their heads.
If we want to seriously compete in the Great Hunt or even get off this mudball, we need the extra credits from these bounties.
These goons have names?
Who are the targets?
They're Fa'athra's underbosses. You'll know them when they start blasting at you.
All I need to compete in the Great Hunt is my blaster.
Do I have to buy my way in?
Yeah? Well, my intel doesn't pay for itself--neither do armor and starships. We need this funding.
We don't have any more time to waste.
On it. Let's go.
You always know what you're doing, don't you?
A man of action to the end. Must be why I like you.
Come on--Fa'athra's palace is waiting....
You just get more and more impressive.
Good to see you again.
Thanks.
You too, girl. Glad to see you're doing so well.
I was thinking the same thing.
I could kill accountants all day.
It's easy when you're me.
Heard you did a number on nasty little Nails, as well.
You'll be seeing a lot of me.
I'm here to stay.
Hope that's true.
Here you go--credits for the accountant. Poor little Yalt with his bossy wife.
See you soon, bounty hunter.
Hey, I think I've got something for you.
I was hoping you'd say that.
My favorite words.
Working women have to watch out for each other.
That's not what I meant. You're a bad one.
Hand it over. I'm in a hurry.
Give it here.
Oh, so friendly!
Did you hear about my job?
Nem'ro tell you why?
I did indeed. Very impressive.
Here you go. Credits for the head of Huttsbane. Good work there.
Good to see you again.
Hello there. Something I can do for you?
What can you tell me about Nem'ro's court?
I'm looking for information.
Not much. I try to keep out of there. The boss tends to get a little overly friendly with me, you know?
Hello there, handsome. Looking for something?
Who might you be?
Let's start with your name.
I'm Juda, Nem'ro's paymaster. If he gives you work, I'm the one you settle up with when the job's done.
Shall we get out of here?
[Flirt] You, beautiful.
Hehe, slow down, sugar. I'm working.
I'm getting the lay of this place.
Just wandering.
New here, huh? No problem.
Don't mean to be rude, but I need to finish crunching these numbers for Nem'ro.
I'll let you get back to them.
Hint taken.
Thanks. It was nice meeting you.
Let's continue this conversation some other time.
[Flirt] See you later.
Sure thing, cute stuff.
I like your outfit, by the way. Very cute.
Pleasure meeting you.
Thanks! I was thinking the same thing about yours!
Can you give me a tour of Nem'ro's vault?
You've got all his credits?
Nice try. I don't have access to the money. I just authorize the vouchers. See you around.
Bit busy here, hon.
